article.headline: Winthrop 72, Charleston Southern 42
article.story: ROCK HILL, S.C. (AP) -- Craig Bradshaw scored 20 points to lead Winthrop to a 72-42 win over Charleston Southern on Tuesday night in the Big South Conference tournament quarterfinals. The top-seeded Eagles (26-4) advance to play No. 5 seed North Carolina-Asheville in the semifinals Thursday night. Winthrop led by three with 15 minutes left in the first half before going on a 15-2 run over the next four minutes that put the Eagles ahead 24-8. Winthrop led 42-24 at half and led by at least 16 points the rest of the way. The Eagles shot 52 percent (26-of-50) from the field, compared to 34 percent (18-of-53) for the Buccaneers (8-22). Winthrop outrebounded Charleston Southern 36-24 to win its 16th game in a row and extend its home winning streak to 21 games. Dwayne Jackson led the Buccaneers with 16 points, while Donnell Covington added seven points and six rebounds. Torrell Martin scored 15 points and DeAndre Adams added eight assists for the Eagles.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
